web.title: Excuse App
web.lead: Excuse generator: filters, tone variants, illustrated 2D UI.
web.description: A playful mobile app where users craft an excuse using criteria (target, style, intensity), with an art direction inspired by urban signage and gaming.
web.overview: Experience-first project: a simple flow (pick criteria → generate → iterate) wrapped in an illustrated, animated 2D interface. I designed the full art direction (sets, illustrations, micro-animations) and structured the app to keep navigation smooth, logic readable, and the content system easy to expand (new criteria, tones, categories).
role: Generation logic: criteria, variants, tone levels

web.title: SideGeek
web.lead: Info platform + student database: Vue.js & Laravel, team project.
web.description: Collaborative project (Vue.js + Laravel): building a training platform and a database connected to learner profiles.
web.overview: Team project focused on delivering a structured, maintainable app across front and back. I contributed to UI integration, component planning, and Git/GitHub organization (branches, PRs, reviews). The goal was both delivery and a clean base: conventions, clear splitting, and solid team communication.

web.title: Pasta Timer
web.lead: Cooking app: timers, pasta types, recipes, fun alarm.
web.description: A pasta-focused mobile app: choose pasta type, timing, recipes, and alarms — with a fully hand-crafted illustrated art style.
web.overview: Utility + personality: an easy flow (choose → timer → alert) enriched with content (pasta types, recipes, tips) and a strong illustrated identity. I built a clean structure (JSON data, components, navigation) so the app stays stable and easy to extend (new types, recipes, variations).

web.title: McDo
web.lead: E-commerce demo: cart, checkout, delivery, responsive UI.
web.description: Shopping & delivery website with a product → cart → confirmation flow, designed to be clear and maintainable.
web.overview: Front-focused project with state logic: navigation, catalog, cart, summary, and responsive UX. I worked on component structure, UI consistency, and a readable purchase flow. Goal: a simple but clean app with predictable behavior and a scalable base. I also created the art direction and visual assets (graphics, composition, overall visual consistency).
role: Art direction + asset creation + perceived performance

web.title: Why Not
web.lead: UI concept: community & planning platform, dark/light modes.
web.description: Figma mockup for a community-driven planning platform, with dark & light variants and a product-minded user flow.
web.overview: Design-first project: information hierarchy, user journey, reusable UI components, and navigation logic. The goal was a solid base before development: coherent screens, styling system, and clean dark/light variations. I shaped a design system (typography, spacing, components) to make future front-end implementation straightforward.

web.title: Sneakers
web.lead: Shoe e-commerce: React + DB, street/cosmic visual world.
web.description: A responsive shoe e-commerce website with cart flow, backed by a full art direction (illustrations, animations, light/dark atmospheres).
web.overview: Full front-end project with e-commerce logic: listing, details, cart, and a smooth experience across screen sizes. The standout element is the strong visual identity: two worlds (colorful street in light mode, cosmic in dark mode), with illustrated and animated assets. I kept the structure clean (components, data, styles) to maintain predictable behavior and easy maintenance.
role: Art direction: illustrations, animations, light/dark identity

web.title: NISA
web.lead: Neuroscience institute: Figma mockup, dark/light, clear structure.
web.description: Figma mockup for a neuroscience institute: editorial hierarchy, sections, and consistent dark & light variants.
web.overview: Content and readability-driven: a structure designed to present an institute (mission, research, news, contact) without clutter. I worked on typographic hierarchy, grids, and reusable components to achieve a serious yet modern look. The dual theme (dark/light) was designed from day one to stay coherent (contrast, accents, states).

threeD.title: Tarmac
threeD.lead: Blender modeling + animation: assets, shading, final video.
threeD.description: End-to-end 3D project: modeling, shading, animation and video editing, with custom asset creation.
threeD.overview: Production-oriented pipeline: build a coherent result from A to Z (modeling, materials, lighting, animation), then deliver a clean video (rhythm, cuts, export). I focused on perceived quality via shading/lights and motion readability, while keeping a clear pipeline (scenes, assets, exports) to iterate safely.

threeD.title: Brainy
threeD.lead: Cartoon character: sculpt, shapes, render — social content (TikTok).
threeD.description: Cartoon character creation: sculpting, proportions, details and rendering, designed for social formats (TikTok).
threeD.overview: Character-focused project: exploring a readable cartoon style (silhouette, expressions, shapes) and achieving a clean, cohesive render. I worked on sculpting, detailing, and presentation for social formats: fast readability, simple but effective lighting, and outputs ready to publish.

all.description: Cartoon character creation: sculpting, proportions, details and rendering, designed for social formats (TikTok).

I worked on sculpting, detailing, and presentation for social formats: fast readability, simple but effective lighting, and outputs ready to publish.
